intro: Blepharis aequisepala, commonly known as the common blepharis, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, tubular flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink or purple. The plant grows as a low-growing annual herb, often found in grasslands and open areas. Its foliage consists of narrow, linear leaves that are arranged alternately along the stems. The species is notable for its ability to thrive in arid conditions, making it an important component of its native ecosystems.
